name: Max Builds Web
tagline: Web-apps with Elixir, Elm, and Ruby
body:
### I'm Max Gorin
I've been in love with web-development since 2007, mainly credit to Ruby on Rails. Recently, I'm very excited to work with Elixir and Elm. I love producing polished UIs, as well as clean and well-architectured code.

### Open source work
During a few years, I developed and maintained [Netzke](http://netzke.org) - an ExtJS/Rails library, that helps building desktop-like web-application in a conveniently modular way. I gave a few talks on Netzke at Ruby conferences around the world, one example being [RubyKaigi 2013](http://stream.rubydaily.org/post/53936363442/rapid-development-of-enterprise-web-apps-with) in Tokyo.

### Freelancing
I've worked with a number of companies from Europe, Asia and the US. As I'm very mobile, I prefer spending the initial month working on-site, so that I get closely acquainted with the project and the team, and then I switch to working remotely for another few months. I choose to work 6 hours a day, 4 days a week, so that I'm always focused, fresh and productive.

Here's an example of feedback I occasionally get from developers I work with:

> I’m very happy with having you on the team. I like how you are just part of the team, like the rest, despite being remote. I especially like how I don’t have to worry about whether you are stuck or anything; I know if something comes up, you’ll let us know.

--- [Arjan van der Gaag](https://twitter.com/avdgaag), received on Slack on April 25, 2016.

### My pet projects

* [Pairs One](http://pairs.one) - multi-player Memory game that works without registration (Elm, Elixir/Phoenix, Redis)
* [!Fragmenter](https://fragmenter.net) - an online diary with a few unique features (React, Ruby on Rails, PostgreSQL)

### Get in touch!
You can reach me on email: gorinme at gmail. I speak English, Russian, Spanish, and Dutch.
